Many companies like yours are on the hunt for salespeople who can not only connect with buyers but also truly understand the market and deliver outstanding results against the competition. It's a tough world out there, and finding the right fit can leave you feeling overwhelmed and stressed. 

Now, imagine transforming your hiring process and filling your sales team with enthusiastic individuals who can genuinely resonate with your customers. Picture a team of motivated superstars who thrive in your unique market and tackle competition with confidence while selling at your price points!  What if you could learn the secrets to attracting and onboarding top sales talent? The good news is—you can!

Join us for our **Sales Hiring Secrets** program and unlock the groundbreaking strategies that will redefine your hiring approach! On **January 28th from 1 PM to 4:30 PM**, get ready for an engaging session packed with invaluable insights! For just $97, you’ll receive comprehensive worksheets, handy templates, and access to session replays, ensuring you’re supported long after the event. 

Don’t let hiring struggles keep your business from thriving! Click the link for more information and to secure your spot today! Let’s make your dream team a reality!

posts.name:
Milagros Zegarra
Milagros Zegarra
posts.content:
⭐️INYECTAS O QUITAS ENERGÍA? 

Todos queremos estar siempre llenos de energía, entusiasmo y que en lo posible nadie nos quite ese estado ideal.

Lo cierto es que hay personas que nos quitan energía y otras que nos la inyectan!

 Y como todo lo que damos regresa a nosotros y multiplicado, hoy te comparto algunas sugerencias para inyectarla: ️

1️⃣Ofrece palabras de aliento:
Una simple frase positiva puede levantarle el ánimo a alguien y darle un impulso de energía para todo el día o la semana entera.

2️⃣Comparte una sonrisa:
Sonreír es contagioso y manda señales positivas no solo a tu cuerpo sino al estado de ánimo los demás.

3️⃣Escucha activamente:
A veces, solo escuchar a alguien y mostrar interés genuino en lo que dice, puede hacer que se sienta valorado y energizado.
Además escuchando ayudamos a que la otra persona, descargue sus preocupaciones.

4️⃣Propón actividades divertidas: Organiza una salida, un juego o una actividad recreativa o simplemente diferente, así ayudarás a recargar energías.

5️⃣Ofrece ayuda:
Aliviar la carga que alguien lleva “en el hombro”, genera un impulso de energía, y empieza la secuencia de un círculo virtuoso, que tarde o temprano regresa a nosotros…

6️⃣Comparte una comida saludable:
Compartir una comida nutritiva puede proporcionar energía física y emocional.

7️⃣Haz cumplidos sinceros: Reconocer los logros y cualidades de alguien puede aumentar su autoconfianza y energía, y si lo hacemos con honestidad también ayudaremos a su crecimiento.

8️⃣Crea un ambiente positivo:
No solo en cuanto a la parte actitudinal que es vital, también mantén un ambiente limpio, ordenado y lleno de luz, así influirás positivamente en los niveles de energía de las personas.

9️⃣Inicia una conversación interesante:
Hablar sobre temas que apasionen a la otra persona puede despertar su interés y energía, además siempre hay muchas cosas que aprender.

Practica la gratitud:
Expresar agradecimiento y reconocer las cosas buenas que hacen por nosotros, definitivamente mejora el ánimo y la energía de todos.

Y tú, de qué manera inyectas energía? Te leo

⭐️

comments.commentText: Héctor Daniel Alcántara Magaña muchas gracias por compartir mi post!

comments.commentText:
I am writing to highlight my repeated unpleasant experiences with Swiggy. As a loyal Zomato user, I recently decided to try Swiggy after enrolling in Swiggy Black. Unfortunately, my experiences have been consistently disappointing, and the issues are recurring.

I placed an order at 7:00 PM for my 5-year-old daughter, who is unwell. The initial estimated delivery time was 25 minutes. However, 1.5 hours later, the order had still not been delivered.

When I reached out to Swiggy’s support team, they extended the delivery time repeatedly, without any meaningful resolution.

Despite knowing this, Swiggy failed to notify me or take corrective action. Instead, they continued to delay the delivery time and offered a Rs. 100 voucher valid for just two days, which felt insincere and dismissive of the situation.

In contrast, I have never encountered such issues with Zomato, which has consistently provided reliable and prompt service. I strongly urge Swiggy to address these systemic problems, improve its delivery process, and show genuine concern for customers. Until these issues are resolved, I advise potential users to reconsider using Swiggy.

posts.name:
Sarah Touzani
Sarah Touzani
posts.content:
Want to know what kills company culture instantly?

Your team wayching laid-off colleagues get ghost

Last week they were:
• In every team meeting
• Part of every celebration
• Grabbing coffee with you
• Solving problems together

Then the layoff hits.

Suddenly they're:
• Off Slack
• Out of meetings
• Removed from email
• And apparently off-limits for contact?

That last part?
That's on us.

Here's what most people do:
• Avoid reaching out ("It's awkward")
• Stop engaging ("Don't know what to say")
• Ghost completely ("Maybe it's better this way")

Here's what leaders do:
• Send a direct message
• Keep in touch
• Share opportunities
• Make introductions
• Offer to be a reference

It's not complicated.
It's not time-consuming.
It's just being kind.

The reality is:
Your team is watching.
They're taking notes.
They're seeing exactly how disposable relationships are.

Want to destroy psychological safety?
Show your team that friendship expires with employment.

Want to build trust?
Show them you value people over positions.

Three things you can do today:
1. Message someone who was laid off
2. Share their "open for work" post
3. Introduce them to one person

Your culture isn't your ping pong table.
It's how you treat people when things get hard.

What's one thing you wish people did for you during a layoff?

⬇️ Share below

Repost to spread this behaviour
Followfor real talk on building healthy teams

comments.commentText: Soooo accurate like cool now I don’t know how I’ll pay my bills AND you’ve cut off my contact with the 3 people I most want to talk about it with
Leslie Venetz yessss! I can't imagine how tough it is.
